akn:subsection.akn:heading: Effect on Rights of the United States.—

akn:content.akn:p: (b) This chapter shall not be construed to curtail or limit the right of the United States under any other Federal law or any State law—
(c) This chapter shall not be construed to supersede or modify the operation of—
(d) This chapter shall preempt State law to the extent such law is inconsistent with a provision of this chapter.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Effect on Rights of the United States Under Foreign and International Law.—

akn:content.akn:p: (e) This chapter shall not be construed to curtail or limit the rights of the United States under foreign law, under a treaty or an international agreement, or otherwise under international law.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Applicability of Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.—

akn:content.akn:p: (f) Except as provided otherwise in this chapter, the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure shall apply with respect to actions and proceedings under this chapter.
